results.title: Financial Stability Oversight Council Insurance Member Continuity Act
results.short_title: Financial Stability Oversight Council Insurance Member Continuity Act
results.summary: Financial Stability Oversight Council Insurance Member Continuity Act This bill amends the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to modify the term of the independent member with insurance expertise of the Financial Stability Oversight Council to allow the current member to continue to serve in the event of a delay in the naming of a successor by the end of the member's six-year term. In such a case, the independent member may continue to serve until 18 months after the end of the term or until a successor is confirmed, whichever is earlier.
results.summary_short: Financial Stability Oversight Council Insurance Member Continuity Act This bill amends the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to modify the term of the independent member with insurance expertise of the Financial Stability Oversight Council to allow the current member to continue to serve in the event of a delay in the naming of a successor by the end of the member's six-year term. actions.description: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 1 (Roll no. 439). (text: CR H6637)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6643)
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H6637-6638)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 1 (Roll no. 439).

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3110.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hultgren moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 211.
Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-293.
Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 60 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

votes.question: On Motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass
